skill.name: verification-before-completion
skill.description: Use when about to claim work is complete, fixed, or passing, before committing or creating PRs - requires running verification commands and confirming output before making any success claims; evidence before assertions always
skill.summary: Require verification evidence before claiming completion, passing, or success
skill.author: obra

content.value_statement: AI agents often claim work is complete without actual verification. This skill enforces evidence-based completion claims by requiring verification command output before any success assertions. It prevents false completion reports and builds trust through proof.
actual_capabilities: Prevents claims of completion without running verification commands
Requires actual test output showing 0 failures before claiming tests pass
Blocks expressions of satisfaction like 'Great!' or 'Done!' before verification
Verifies agent delegation results independently before trusting reports
Enforces red-green cycles for regression test verification
limitations: Requires the agent to have access to verification commands and their output
Does not execute verification itself - instructs the agent to run commands
Cannot prevent users from ignoring verification results

use_cases.target_user: Development teams using AI coding assistants
use_cases.title: Prevent false completion reports
use_cases.description: Stop AI agents from claiming tests pass or bugs fixed without running the actual verification commands.

use_cases.title: Build trust in AI contributions
use_cases.description: Ensure AI agents provide verification evidence before PRs, reducing rework from false completion claims.

use_cases.title: Enforce verification discipline
use_cases.description: Apply consistent verification standards across all AI agent work before accepting completion.

prompt_templates.title: Basic verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Before claiming this work is complete: 1) What command proves completion? 2) Run it now. 3) Show the output. 4) Only then state the status with evidence.

prompt_templates.title: Test verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Do not claim tests pass. Run the test command now. Report the actual output including failure counts. Show exit code if available.

prompt_templates.title: Build verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the build command and show the full output. Do not rely on linter passing or logs looking good. Report actual build status.

prompt_templates.title: Agent delegation
prompt_templates.prompt: The agent reports success. Before trusting this: Check the VCS diff for actual changes. Run relevant verification commands. Report what you actually verified.

output: Before claiming tests pass, I need to run verification.
Result: All tests pass with verified output
Before claiming the bug is fixed:
Result: Bug symptom no longer occurs
Verified with reproduction steps - issue resolved

best_practices: Always run verification commands fresh - never trust previous runs or cached results
Report actual output including failure counts and exit codes, not interpretations
Apply verification to agent delegation - check VCS diffs and run independent verification
No exceptions for verification - tired, rushed, or confident states do not replace evidence
anti_patterns: Using words like 'should', 'probably', or 'seems to' instead of verified facts
Trusting agent success reports without independent verification of actual results

faq.question: Does this skill execute verification commands?
faq.answer: No. This skill instructs the agent to run verification commands and requires evidence before claims. The agent must execute commands.

faq.question: Can I skip verification for simple tasks?
faq.answer: No. The rule applies to all completion claims without exception, regardless of task complexity.

faq.question: What if verification commands are unavailable?
faq.answer: State that verification could not be performed and do not claim completion. Report the actual status with this limitation.

faq.question: Does this work with agent delegation?
faq.answer: Yes. When a sub-agent reports success, verify independently by checking VCS diffs and running verification commands.

faq.question: How does this handle partial verification?
faq.answer: Partial verification proves nothing. Full verification of the specific claim is required before any completion assertion.

faq.question: What about re-running recent verification?
faq.answer: Run verification fresh each time. Previous results, even from minutes ago, do not satisfy the verification requirement.
